Scramble values rowwise in a data frame

scramble_values_rowwise.Rd

For each row, shuffle the values across the selected columns. All selected columns must be of compatible types (e.g., all numeric or all character).

Usage

scramble_values_rowwise(data, cols)

Arguments

data

a data frame

cols

Columns to scramble rowwise. Supports helpers like starts_with(), contains(), where(), etc.

Value

A data frame with values scrambled rowwise across the selected columns.

Examples

df <- data.frame(
  day_1 = c(1, 4, 7),
  day_2 = c(2, 5, 8),
  day_3 = c(3, 6, 9),
  id = 1:3
)

set.seed(123)
df |> scramble_values_rowwise(starts_with("day_"))
#>   day_1 day_2 day_3 id
#> 1     3     1     2  1
#> 2     5     4     6  2
#> 3     8     9     7  3
df |> scramble_values_rowwise(c("day_1", "day_2"))
#>   day_1 day_2 day_3 id
#> 1     1     2     3  1
#> 2     5     4     6  2
#> 3     7     8     9  3
